wikipedia_page.main: William George Harper (born 15 November 1900) was a Scottish professional footballer who played as a goalkeeper for Sunderland.

response: * Bill Harper (baseball) (1889–1951), Major League Baseball pitcher
* Bill Harper (footballer, born 1897) (1897–1989), Scottish football goalkeeper (Hibernian, Arsenal, national team)
* Bill Harper (footballer, born 1900) (1900–?), Scottish football goalkeeper (Sunderland, Crystal Palace)
* Bill Harper (soccer) (fl. 1968), Canadian soccer player (national team)
* Bill Harper, a character in Ambassador Bill

In December 1931 Harper signed for Plymouth Argyle and went on to make 82 appearances in all competitions between then and 1939.GoS: Bill HarperSoccer at War – 1939 – 45 (2005): Jack Rollin  During the Second World War he worked in the dockyards in Rosyth, Scotland. After the war he returned to Argyle where he served as a trainer, groundsman and even laundryman. Such was his contribution to the club that he was awarded a testimonial match against Arsenal in October 1972. Plymouth's training ground, Harper's Park, is also named after him.
